description: If you r looking for a big bucket of cheap pho then this the place.  Then again you're a fool if you ever pay more than $10 for a bowl anywhere.  The pho was ok, but I didn't think the pho ga (chicken) was better than turtle tower.  The broth just wasn't as good.
author: michele k.

description:
The best thing about this little place is that the broth for their pho is very flavorful.
Additionally, they have large plates of fixins - limes, basil, sprouts, and peppers, to add to your pho.

As is typical of the best pho shops, they tend to have huge portions for very little money.

When you walk in, it smells great inside because of the big pots of broth and grilling pork on your left as you enter.
My wife's BBQ pork over noodles was excellent.
author: Patrick Z.

description: Really good pho!  Don't order the large unless you are REALLY REALLY hungry.  It comes in a small bathtub.
author: Hui C.

description:
Of the 20 or so pho places I've tried in SF, I consider Pho 2000 to be one of the best. Everything I've gotten there has been consistently very good, and their imperial rolls are the best I've found in the city.

Its located in the TL so don't forget your bullet proof vest and heavy artillery.
author: Jordan M.

description:
I've had their Beef Pho and Chicken Pho here, and it's definitely pretty good. At first I was scared of the name to try it. What kind of name is Pho 2000, but I was like, what the heck, I see Vietnamese people eat here, so it can't be too bad. For some reason a lot like Turtle Tower better, but I think those people come from the North, and Turtle Tower uses Northern style Pho, which has no vegetables, and just isn't flavorful to me, who grew up on Southern style, which Pho 2000 does.

Anyway! Their vermicelli noodles (listed under 'bun' pronounced 'boon' for all those non Vietnamese speakers) with Imperial rolls is also excellent, and I'd recommend trying those. My friends and I had a funny experience because I told him to order that, and he's like I'm not sure, because he thought Bun, they just gave you a bun or something. haha.

Anyway, yeah, I like this place. They're really fast, but they only take cash. Boo!!! I still like the Pho at Jasmine Gardens the bestest though :)
author: Xavier G.

description:
Moving to my new work location means I have the opportunity to try all the delights that the TL has to offer. 

I was really craving pho so I did a quick search with the Yelp app and found Pho 2000. I ordered my usual, Pho Tai Bo Vien, rare steak with beef balls.  

The broth is really delicious. Just a hint of star anise but not powerful to the point of overpowering it.

Totally hit the spot. DE-LISH!
author: Gordon A.

description: You know when you work in the FiDi and you're organizing the social gathering for your office Asian and Pacific Islander Heritage month celebration and you find yourself with an RSVP list of 20 and no reservation the week of your event?  No?  This doesn't happen to you?  It happened to me when I returned from my work related travel to find out that my coworker did not make a reservation.  Feeling it important to expose the colleagues to Little Saigon  to get some A/PI heritage - because let's face it, Osha Thai and Slanted Door are the high end versions of what once was humble beginnings like Pho 2000 - we frantically called Pho 2000 on the same day as our outing.  They pick up the phone at 0730 because they're prepping for the day and share that they will hold two tables for us despite our hope to arrive there at the peak of lunch hour.  They request that we order ahead, but don't require it, and give us access to the full menu.  By some miracle, the coworkers all choose their orders by 1045 and we called it in about an hour before our lunch.  We were seated upstairs and cozied up together.  Almost immediately, our food starts coming out - piping hot pho, rice plates, vegetarian selections, pork chops, and Vietnamese coffee (the real way) galore!  It was awesome!!  The service was very friendly and responsive.  We were in and out of there in an hour.  This is comfort food - plain and simple.  Huge servings and great price point hovering just under $10 for most dishes!  Props Pho 2000 for accommodating our group and sharing your food heritage with our racially diverse office!
author: T. W.

description:
I don't know much about Vietnamese food (I've only had it twice, both times at Pho 2000) but my taste buds don't lie and let me tell you, they were quite happy after eating here! 

I got the rice noodles with BBQ pork and shrimp and was really surprised by how good it was. For only $6 I got a HUGE portion with lots of meat and a ton of noodles. The dish was served with a light sauce (tasted a little like rice vinegar), lots of cilantro, carrots, cucumber and a sprinkling of peanuts. I liked it so much that I went back two days later and got the same thing but this time with Imperial rolls and shrimp instead of pork! The food was just as good the second time around so it was no fluke! My boyfriend got the Pho soup with chicken and seemed to really enjoy it as well. There was a ton of chicken and it was all really good white meat. 

I also got the rainbow drink which was a little bazaar...but yummy nonetheless. I didn't know people put red beans in drinks! Guess I have a lot to learn!
author: Amanda R.

description:
I'm a total fan of this place. My partner and I go at least  twice a month and do not dare to go anywhere for pho in the city. My partner loves it because it is hard to come by pho places that have tripe that is well cooked and seasoned-this place has it! I love the amount of food you get and the flavors are great. It's one of the only place I have been to that the pho broth can be eaten on its own and doesn't need seasoning. 
Delicious
author: Audriannah L.

description:
I tried this place out for the first time today as I walked by my beloved Mangosteen.  I had a hankering since the name of this place is inspired by the original Pho 2000 in Saigon - which is my favorite pho place in the world.

My bowl here was very large and piping hot.  The noodles were a bit on the al dente side, which not only tastes good, but tells you that they are fresh and weren't sitting around in water for a long time.  I'd have to say the large slices of very lean meat are a little too thin and I prefer a slice more on the meatier/marbled side.

I definitely like the risk they take in putting their very clean kitchen in the front.  Most pho places have some guy named Hai in the back in a wife beater sweating into your broth while the roaches take over, but maybe that just adds to the flavor that I love.
author: Joey S.

description:
The only thing I need to say about this place is that it's the best Pho place. The egg rolls are the best also. Best Best place for pho.
 cash only
author: Ge I.

description:
Having reviewed the neighborhood Them Ky, I can't not review this other stellar establishment in Little Saigon.

I love me some pho... but I also have a strange addiction to having beef balls with my soup (insert juvenile joke here).  Just happens that these guys always put a bunch.  Nothing really to it, except I really like beef balls in my pho and pho 2000 lets me go to town on them.

Have come here many times before, will keep coming here... end of story.

Very nice & attentive service.
author: greg s.

description:
What a nice find.  Based on the reviews here, I fired up the boxer-twin and adventured into the 'Loin.  Definitely good stuff.  I was hungry so I munched on the Imperial Rolls and a Small #8 Pho (well-done brisket and rare beef).  Nice.

I usually go to the Slanted Door for my fixing of (veggie there) Imperial Rolls, but these guys at Pho 2000 serve up a lot of roll for your $5.  Plus, the regular Imperial rolls don't have shrimp in it (allergic, not kosher), so the pork rolls are great.

The Pho was flavorful.  Around 1:20pm, it wasn't crowded at all, and go substantially emptier (on a Tues) as the afternoon progressed.

Good stuff.
author: Mike P.

description:
Just moved around this area and very very excited to try all the pho restaurants in Little Saigon.  Tried one or two places before making it to Pho 2000.  

Soooooo glad I did.

Ordered the medium Pho Tai (rare steak) and was very pleased with the broth (not too salty or oily) and the amount of meat given.   I also asked for extra onions and they gave me plenty.  mmm!!!

Have been back a couple times since my first visit and it has been awesome every time.  Pho 2000 is probably the only pho place where I eat the whole bowl...get some!!!
author: Tysen C.

description:
I go here for lunch and its fast (in fact one day I was lingering at my table and the buser gave me a look that said "move it fat arse" - lunch rush so I get it.  :)  When I go here I am in and out in 30-45 mins depending on how fast I can suck down the noodles

I like this place.  Out of the dozen pho places for some reason I like the broth here better than the other places - I don't know why I just think it tastes less "fatty/greasy/oily"  And so far no one has brought my pho with their thumb in the soup so that deserves a star or two

I used the bathroom here once (I HATE public restrooms) and it did not make me sick to my stomach...just a little dizzy :D  A decent public restroom in this neighborhood can't be easy so I think that speaks well of the people taking care of this restaurant
author: Angela A.

description: Pho doesnt get any better than Pho 2000. The empirial Rolls are a great way to start things off. I love the #11 ( dont ask me to pronounce the names) and the #5. I like to sit upstairs, but they are steep so if you have bad knees or cant do stairs the lower level can get crowded around dinner time. Price is perfect. 7 bucks for more Pho than you could eat at one time. Makes a great breakfast the next day.
author: Matt H.

description:
Ughhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh.....

I was so excited this morning when I found a Pho place open, I love Pho for breakfast or is it I love Pho for hangovers... either way I was one happy girl to see that Pho 2000 was open at 8:30am. I wasn't expecting the best pho of my life and to be honest found it to be good and cheap. Until  I was at the bottom of my bowl I found hair- straight asian course strand of hair. I have thin fine split ended hair... Now I'm just grossed out knowing it's been in there with whatever else I didn't fine and I ate almost the whole darn thing....
author: Gracie A.

description: Had the chicken Pho number 13 it was excellent. I could not finish the large size pho but for the price it is a great value.  Fast service. Very clean establishment had a score of 90 by SF public health for food safety. Will go back for sure.
author: vahid r.

description: Much better experience (pho and service) than turtle tower! Fast, reliable, nice staff. My go to pho spot!
author: Caroline L.

description: Good service, good price, not as busy as turtle tower and a better atmosphere to boot.
author: Philip S.

description: Great place to eat pho. It's in a bad neighborhood, i'll give you that. But you can't really complain given the cheap price and the fact that it's so good! The service has always been good (nothing really great but no complaints here) and you can't beat paying only $14 for two people. This is my go-to pho place in SF. And another thing, they don't try to skip out on the meat. I feel like the proportions are very generous and just right.
author: Hannah K.

description:
I don't know exactly how to score this review. I did go there and i did eat some Pho, but it did not stay...ummm...with me? I came early for lunch and got a BIG bowl of beef pho that had plenty of everything you'd expect. Broth was hot, but too light. Didn't have nearly as much flavor as other pho spots usually do. Everything else was standard, and the 'add-on' plate was fresh as ever. Way fresher than my usual spot. 
The large bowl was insanely big. No human can eat that much, but i tried. And wish i hadn't! I was fine for a good 30 mins after, i did feel crazy full for a few minutes, and after that came utter sickness. I turned my bathroom into a private vomitorium that was most unpleasant. Did i eat too much? Maybe...? Was the food bunk?  I don't know...now maybe you can understand why i don't know how to score my experience? Is Yelp strictly for pre or post vomit? Is there a secret 30 minute rule?? Are 'roman rules' in effect on Yelp?
Regardless...sorry P2K, not gonna risk another tossing of my beloved cookies to risk it again.
author: Karl H.

description: This place is okay.  Their bun bo hue is sweet for some reason.  I've had better in Oakland and Santa Rosa.  As for their pho... it does the trick.  I would come back for pho if I was craving it.  I'd be more likely to go to Bodega Bistro though.
author: Erika C.

description: I only come here for one reason THE PHO.  The broth tastes amazing and they give you a generous serving size for Large Bowls.  It might look small when you first walk In but there is extra seating upstairs.  Priced well.  Highly recommended.
author: Thavi Y.

description: Best chicken broth ever; rich, savory, and very satisfying. Go there often and am never disappointed. Five thumbs up for the best Pho in San Francisco.
author: Roger G.

description:
When it comes to Pho, I like my broth beefy, oh boy, it was beefy!  The price is right, the food is right, and now, I feel right.  Always get the large, even if your not that hungry... It's only like 80 cents more.

I tend to stick to the plain rare steak pho and meatballs, but this last time I added brisket... it was so delicious.  thye also have pretty good imperial and spring rollsl for your "non asian friends..."  or the people that think Vietnamese food is hella exotic.

Eat up, Enjoy, and keep that wallet Heavy!
author: Victor n.

description:
My initial thought as I walked up to this restaurant was "wtf...Pho 2000, what kind of name is that?" Then was quickly reminded these folk are asian and immediately my skepticism turned to optimism. We walk in...

I am enveloped by the amazing smell and sounds of sizzling beef. We look around and see all the tables on the lower lever were filled by asians (YES!). We're seated by friendly waiters dressed in bright yellow and red outfits and the beautiful sight of Hoisin Sauce (cha-ching). For those of you who do not know this is a tell tale sign this is  southern vietnamese and I have been longing for some good southern style vietnamese. 

On this particular day I was feeling rather ambitions and decided to order two entrées: Bun Rieu and whatever #15 was, it was a chicken and noodle dish. Both were very tasty. The Bun Rieu was spot on and to my surprise the crabmeat cakes were plentiful. Already satisfied with the soup the noodles i ordered came, and they smelled delicious. This was a simple dish consisting of egg noodles and chicken, but you could taste the "wok hay." I haven't had vietnamese this good since I lived in San Jose. My only gripe is with the bean sprouts and mint condiments being a bit wilted and old. I gotta try the Bun Bo Hue the next time I go. And I will be going back again soon.
author: vinh t.

description: Great Pho, everything is fresh and delicious.  I usually get the Chicken Pho and Pho 2000's isn't overly fatty or loaded with skin and gristle. I showed up there late one evening right before they were closing and they were still super nice and courteous.
author: Nathan J.

description:
i am no expert on pho...not sure what i ate was even pho...

i had vermicelli noodles with sauteed beef  #20 on the menu...

very filling and very tasty..i couldnt eat the whole bowl...which coming from me is saying something i am a pig!!!

Very friendly staff too.....and cheap!!!!
author: Ripley B.

description: Food is okay, we feel they are pretty stingy with ingredients...too little salty plum and coconut & beans in drink. Bun Xeo is too oily.
author: H T.

description:
Went with a few friends....

Vegetarian rolls are good and better than some places.
Pho is good.
Bun cha gio, bun chay is good.

Unpretentious, good, cheap eats. Attentive service!

Been here 2 times already!
author: Mango M.

description:
Using a quasi-objective rating system, I will take you into a journey for all ages. Breaking it down to components, I cater to customers who favor "taste," "service," "price" and/or "decor." Sometimes you are just a poor dude who just wants the best bang for his buck (like me). Or you want to be treated like royalty. Maybe you want to pretend in your glamourless life that you are sitting in a fancy restaurant. Perhaps like most people, you mainly look for taste on top of these things. As a result of having to add up separate sub-ratings on a 4-star scale (with 1 star reserved for special bonuses), my ratings tend to counter the inflated bimodal averages you see all over Yelp. But heed my reviews, and having lowered expectations will probably enhance your eating experience. I would recommend any place I rate 2 stars or greater. Also, all my ratings are rounded down, so read and look at my actual overall score.

Conclusion: 2.75/5
That said, Pho 2000 is a pretty good place in terms of the food. I see myself returning here for years to come!

Decor: 0.5
This place has two stories! That's something reserved for fancy Chinese places. Or places that barely have any room on the first floor. Still, we always sit at the big table dangerously overlooking the table below because we come in a gaggle of several first-year law students. It's a nice view.

Food: 0.75
It's good. It tastes like your standard issue pho. But then pho is good. So it tastes good. I tried an egg roll, and that was good, too.

Service: 0.25
Well, at least they seem to speak some English. Not sure if they understand it besides the names on the menu, except one guy who seems like the manager. I've asked for something (like water, napkins) and not gotten it multiple times, until I ask the manager. Though I suppose bringing bowls of hot soup upstairs is no baby feat.

Price: 1
Fair for the amount of pho, unlike Hai Ky Mi Gia. No complaints here.

Bonus: 0.25
Just because of "Phome 2000" (see Nome 2000 v. Fagerstrom).
author: Brian H.

description: Affordable and tasty.  One word of caution though, the large is really large.  Any bigger and they'd need to start one of those challenges you see on the food channels where you get a free T-shirt if you can finish the entire bowl within an hour.  Broth was a little understated but good.  I'll definitely be back, but don't think I've got the metabolism try another large
author: Nosniv X.

description: Whenever Turtle Tower is too packed or when I'm craving something a little more flavorful, I stop by Pho 2000 for some delicious pho. This place serves up some piping hot bowls, towering with noodles and seafood. This place is definitely the place to go when you're super hungry, as the portions are humongous. I also love how the kitchen is in the front of the restaurant so you can see them stir up the pots of broth and ladle everything into your bowl. I'm always skeptical of pho places (like the Pho Hoa chain) that don't seem to be clean or have the best hygiene.
author: Carolyn W.

description:
Good solid pho, fast service, and they seem to have turned up the temperature on the broth, which is good, because it definitely needed it. The meat was well cut, and the portions were good but not extremely generous. A medium will be fine. Price is great. 

As far as the Tenderloin goes, Larkin is not really a bad part of the Tenderloin, just don't be an idiot and you'll be fine. For the really skittish, walk down Van Ness to Ellis, take Ellis towards Larkin, go to pho, take the same route out. There you go, you walked only 1 block in the TL.
author: David H.

description:
Wow! Pho 2000 really cranks up the flavor, and they dish up a lot of it! The large bowls are huge, and based on this I'd guess that their small bowls are the size of most restaurants' larges. The noodles and cuts of meat are perfect, and the bowls are chock full of both. There's so much meat that you will run out of noodles before meat, as you reach the bottom of the bowl. The restaurant itself is very clean and they have a mezzanine in the back which gives them a good amount of seating. The confidence and pride they have in their product shows, as they put the kitchen in the front window for all to see.

I do agree with Wakako that the broth is a little sweeter than you'd typically find. It was a little unusual but definitely did not detract from the flavorfulness of the soup. All in all, Pho 2000 is a stellar dining experience.
author: Tony L.

description:
The broth was weak.  I think Meh is the best way to describe it.  

Skip it.
author: Clayton K.

description: Sooo good! A couple of my law school friends and I were searching for a good pho place. Turtle Tower looked too crowded and we decided to give Pho 2000 a chance simply because we got a kick out of the name. Despite our large group, we were able to get a table upstairs. We unintentionally beat the lunch rush, which was good because this placed filled up ten minutes later. I order my standard chicken pho and a lot of my friends order other things off the menu. Good prices and good atmosphere, we had a great time. No complaints about the service and can't wait to go back.
author: Stephanie L.

description: The go-to spot for big steaming bowls of pho in SF. grad-school student budget approved.
author: Jeff S.

description:
omg so good. i eat here at least once a week. pho be the best comfort food eva.


Want to also point out that the meal portion and quality to price ration is great value. This place also has excellent rice dishes.
author: Jessica M.

description:
Hai Ky on Ellis & Larkin was closed, I wasn't in the mood for Turtle Tower, and my beloved Pho Tan Hoa, on Jones St, was a bit too far. I haven't bothered to check the new space next to Turtle Tower, so enter Pho 2000.

I'd give this place 2.5 stars, but veering towards the lower end based on my pho experience. I ordered the special combo pho, medium size (rare beef, tendon, beef ball and tripe). The broth was yummy, and standard fare, but I was very disappointed my broth was not piping hot! It was me and one other customer in the joint waiting for service, and I was sitting almost in front of the kitchen. It had me wondering if 1. my server was too slow, or even worse 2. their broth is not kept piping hot. I'm hoping it was the former, 'cos a lukewarm broth is a crime. So based on taste, I'd give the broth 3 stars, but I hope to come back again and have a better experiece.

2 stars for the WATERED DOWN (read "weak") iced coffee that was skimpy on coffee and sweetness. They serve it to you already mixed, which made me wonder if it was instant. Is it?

To pipe in on some of the previous reviews: yes, it's very clean inside, and the bathroom was spotless; in regards to being served from a tray, I had the opposite experience whereas my server brought over my pho bowl with her hands (which attests to my broth not being hot) -- I thought this was strange, but didn't think anything of it till now.

My server (the young girl, possibly the owner's daughter) was very sweet, and the taste of the pho broth was good, so I hate giving this place a lower rating. It's open later than my usual pho/noodle spots, so I hope to give it another chance w/other menu items.
author: Antoi C.

description:
The pho is excellent. The broth was really flavorful.
I have been on the pho-crawl in the TL lately and this place is at the top of my list.
I will be back.
The fact that the place is clean and the service genuine doesn't hurt either.
author: Christyan M.

description: Never a wait, consistent and cheap. The staff's nice enough and leave you to eat your pho. Cash only but at least you don't need much.
author: Ann C.

description:
Pho and pork + imperial roll fried rice plate. 

Delish.
author: Dorothy N.

description:
-Good prices

-Nice portions

-Clean and new restaurant.

-Food tasted good.

-Good Service.

-Yup yup, would go more often if it wasn't so far from home :[
author: Danny Y.

description:
Phuck Turtle Tower!!

Pho 2000 is the spot!!!!
author: Dylan n.

description: Fast service, huge helpings of food, polite server. The one down side is that they only accept cash. A little inconvenience but otherwise, overall it's good if you just want pho.
author: Jessica B.

description:
A couple of weeks ago they added some new soups and a curry chicken rice plate to their menu.

My new favorite soup is now Bun Rieu. Check it out. It has shrimp paste, crab, minced pork, and I think there is some soft tofu in it. The salad that comes with it consists of shredded cabbage, lime, sliced jalapenos and several types of greens. She has mint, cilantro, and something that I have seen before but don't know what it is called. Put lots of chili sauce in it and have fun!
author: Marcia P.

description: Eat here and you will soon realize why there is a line outside of Turtle Tower next door. The pho at Pho 2000 is poor as far as pho goes. I stuck with my usual rare been pho. First thing- the beef was not rare- it was well done and fairly tough. The broth was grotesquely oily too. As far as pho is concerned, this place is at the bottom of the barrel for me! Even the service wasn't very good. I had to wait about 10 minutes for the bill. Now if it was crowded I could understand. But it was half empty in the restaurant(cause all the smart people were next door at Turtle Tower :) The only reason why this place is getting 3 stars is because even bad pho is still pretty good.
author: David D.

description: Pho 2000 is just the traditional pho that you crave after a long hard day and night.  The portions are huge, it is fairly priced, and you should always go for the large because it is only $.60 more!  There is plenty of hoysin and sriracha to go around and your belly will be full with hours of delicious pho after you eat at this place.  Honestly, they give you so much pho here that you are going to feel like a thief because you got away with so much...they should have a theme song: The Pho Intruder Song.
author: Min P.

description:
I love pho. I've tried a lot of pho at a lot of different places and this place is my favorite.  Pagolac, Ha Nam Ninh, Pho Tan Hoa, and Golden Star are all delicious but Pho 2000 edges them out for a few reasons. 
1. Tea is always free.  I feel so cheated when I see a charge for it on the bill at other places.  Also the sprout/basil leaf/pepper plates are fresh. 
2. The family that runs this place are nice, hard working, laid back people.  I often go in by myself and linger for an hour eating and reading/crossword puzzling.  No one has ever rushed me to pay and leave.  Plus they refill said free tea.
3. It's clean and cute inside.  Usually I don't really care about "ambiance" but the big skylight and bright wall paint are cheering.
4. It's the best deal of all the places.  For about $7 you get an ENORMOUS bowl of soup with tons of noodles and meat.  I almost never order the large because I don't come even close to finishing it and I'm a certified fattie.
5. Not only does the name sound like some robot sent from the future to protect the earths supply of pho but the t-shirts the staff wear say "it's pho-nomenal"  They need to sell those because I want one.
author: Elizabeth K.

description: Pho 2000 is a really good place to eat, it's affordable and delicious what more could you want from a restaurant, the service is very quick surprisingly, Their spring rolls are awesome, they also have a very friendly staff. I defiantly recommend Pho 2000 to anyone who enjoys Vietnames food.
author: Marlo V.

description: Not the cheapest PHO in the TL, but I really appreciate that it isn't loaded with salt. Most PHO places seem to put massive amounts of salt in to their broth, this doesn't seem to be the case with PHO2000. I recommend them. The place is reasonably clean, and the staff is pretty friendly. They don't harass you too much, but they are quick to give you your menu, take your order and once you've asked for it, they are very quick to bring you check. I've never felt rushed at this place, even when they're full.
author: Ross W.

description: The bun bo hue was ok here.. Could use some more flavor. The portion was huge!
author: Princess N.

description: Awesome pho! One of my favorite local joints for Vietnamese food.
author: Vincent P.

description: I've only had the pho, but it's some of the best I've had. The service is good and the prices are great!  A good, honest place.
author: Geoff B.

description:
Not great but fast and cheap Pho. 

I got the rare beef and the beef pieces were perfectly round slices stuck together like they had just come out of the freezer package in one big chunk. I know there is probably not great beef in any cheap Pho, but this just made it look a little unappetizing. Once I got over that though, it was not bad.
author: Alexa W.

description: For some reason when people talk about Pho they tend to use a lot of bad puns.  Particularly on Yelp. Pho sizzle my nizzle.  Crap like that.  I will refuse to use such stupid language, though this pho was super good. For sure.
author: Murat B.

description: I frequent the #1 Pho Dat Biet at Pho 2000 at least once a week since it's so close my bus stop. The soup is very tasty and you get a lot of beef and pho noodles in the Large. Although it's not necessary, unless you are super hungry, adding extra noodles is only a dollar and extra beef is $2. The staff is very nice as well.
author: Lou T.

description: Pho 2000! Cheap and good. This place is located in the TL, it's a small hole in the wall Vietnamese restaurant.  I usually get the chicken noodle soup with egg noodle.
author: SF S.

description: Most of the items on the menu are under $7 and portions are FATA$S ones..perfect for the fat girl inside me!  I live exactly 2 minutes walking distance so I come here sans makeup in mismatching pj's and they still give me fast, excellent customer service whether I feel like carry-out or sitting by sick/hungover/hungry+lazy self and eating . The pho broth is the best I've had in San Francisco (better than PPQ or Kevin's, methinks).   The cha gio (JAI YAAAWWW) aka eggrolls are probably  one of the best I've had.  Get the vermicelli bowl with it + bbq pork (bun cha gio thit nuong).  You can watch them make your food right up front so chances are that their kitchen is a tad bit cleaner than other hidden kitchens...right...?
author: Tokki M.

description: Ate here a couple of times..the pho here was definitely nothing to write home about.  Service was ok. Plenty of good restaurants in the Ls to be eating here tho.
author: Mikey L.

description:
i like this place they gave me a great bowl of pho with tendon, tripe, pork blood, beef balls, and the fresh meat slices..

i love pork blood that tastes great.
author: Asa D.

description: My favorite pho place in Little Saigon.  The broth is spot on, the service is fast, and it's open super early in the morning for when I need to nurse a hangover.
author: Maxine S.

description: Mmmm delicious pho ga. Just what I was looking for! Everyone is super nice here.
author: Jeanne C.

description: I've been on a pho kick lately. Had every intention of trying Turtle Tower while I was in the 'hood but they were closing in 10 minutes so I came here as a consolation prize/last resort. So glad I did, too. Pho Tai Nam: the steak was thin and rare on arrival and the flank was moist and tender. Flavorful broth. OK noodles. Very OK price. Not a fancy place and cash only but no complaints from me or the Mrs.
author: Will R.

description: I think this place is way better than turtle tower.  The portions are good sized, and nothing beats a bowl of hot, steaming pho with fresh bean sprouts and lots of sriracha.  When you are craving pho, this is the perfect place to go.
author: Carmen L.

description: Definitely one of the best phos you can ever get in the downtown area.  I love their delicate yet flavorful soup.  Some other dishes I have tried are also quite good and gently priced.
author: Fuschia Jane B.

description:
I'm a sucker for pho. It fills my belly up, agrees with me post drinking and won't drain my wallet. Pho is also very reminiscent of one of my favorite soups my mom makes, cocido (beef based stock full of veggies where you add rice and lemon/ lime and salsa). After consumption, I know I won't have to eat until the next day and my stomach will be all warm and poochy (not very attractive but comfy).

So I've popped into this place several times. I dig the fact that the kitchen is open and in the front and that the service is speedy (I usually have tea and a server at my table within 3 to 5 minutes of entering). Not the biggest space but its a cozy and clean place. I tend to alternate between the #8 pho combo (rare beef and cooked flank) and the pho ga (chicken soup). Both are delicious and usually arrive to my table hot hot hot with a large handful of cilantro and green onion on top (The pho ga is usually close to scalding hot; I should know, I've burnt my eager tongue twice). The usual plate of fixins (sprouts, thai basil, lemon) grows with the number of people ordering pho (which I find refreshing because in quite a few places I'll get the same amount whether its just me ordering pho or there are three of us;it's frustrating and I don't like fighting for sprouts :( ). I'm unfamiliar with the rest of the menu with the exception of a few nibbles of the BBQ pork chops and rice, which were tasty but not exactly a dish I'd crave. 

Pho 2000 is a spot to consider if you're on a budget. A filling lunch or dinner for two is easily under $20 (usually with an ample tip) or if you're one of those people who can eat pho for breakfast, I think they open around 8:30 in the am. Tasty and affordable.
author: Veronica G.

description: No lines, quick and attentive service, great pho and huge portions for cheap. I love this place! Screw Turtle Tower.
author: Maggie X.

description: One of the better places in Tenderloin for Pho. I ordered the fresh beef pho with a side order of fresh beef. It was very good the beef was fresh and the garnishes were too. I wish they'd take credit cards like a $15 minimum because I wanted to order more maybe for take home but couldn't so plan ahead.
author: N A.

description: oh no another wannabe place for PHO. plus a copycat place of almost everything on the block. Can they not create a unique item on the menu. I do prefer authentic soups but this place does not cut it for my friends and I. I still donot get why they serve what almost in the 5 mile radius the same as everyone. I still prefer my TurtleTower,Hoa KY,Bodega and the Crawfish joint called Red Crawfish. Oh i forgot AnhHong and Pagaloc...Yummmy.
author: jacqueline c.

description: Had the rare beef pho.  Really good but didn't blow me away.  Still searching for "the one".  Service and prices were average and I found the atmosphere to be more pleasant than next door at turtle tower.
author: Lily C.

description: TL definitely have good vietnamese food - actually, that street has a few good viet places.  I came to Pho 2000 because my friend said their Bun Rieu is really good.  Since I really like Bun Rieu, I thought I'd give it a try. Their soup was good but not enough flavor... it felt like something was missing... the noodles that they use is like other viet places so nothing special there. The egg/crab meat was very smooth and fluffy.  That was the only thing that stood out in this Bun Rieu.  Maybe next time I'll try something else.  I also tried a pork blood from my friend but it did not taste fresh at all. Hopefully it's better next time!
author: Kapo T.

description:
Great place for Southern style Vietnamese pho.  I expecially like their cold rice noodles, they make the noodles just right, with large portions.

Their pho is outstanding, with good soup.
author: Victor L.

description: Okay, first off, I'm bummed I wasn't the first one to Yelp this place but seems like Bobby H. was hungrier than me!  Been wanting to eat here since I saw their Grand Opening signs.  When I got in they had me sit upstairs.  Narrow staircase makes it feel a bit claustrophobic.  Have to commend the waiters walking up those stairs with the hot bowls of noodles.  Not sure I could do it.   As for the food, when it finally arrived, the waiter couldnt' even tell which bowl belonged to whom.  I ended up eating my coworkers noodles.  However, the beef was really fresh as well as the beansprouts/basil.  Portion was average.  Soup was a bit weak for my tastes.  When the check came, it looked a bit high to me.  (Yes, I had asked for the additional noodles for $1 extra but I could not see any discernible difference in quantity between my bowl and my coworkers).  It turned out they had forgotten to incorporate the 20% discount on the meal per their advertisement. (20% during first two weeks).  Overall, not a bad place for pho but not a Must Eat either.  I'd like to see how the place holds up after a few months (will the ingredients stay as fresh and will the sauce bottles stay as clean?)
author: Wayne C.

description:
i just wanted some pho, and i didn't care where and how, just needed it.  saw the word "pho..." outside and popped in. to my surprise the place was very clean, and almost trendy... not the sort of pho shop i was expecting in The Loin!

the first thing i noticed is the kitchen is in the front and and visible from the dining area... pretty different from the pho places with the curtain blocking the back so you dont see them remix left-over broth lol..
  
amazing spring rolls.  for the soup, normal prices, normal servings, normal good taste.  but i'm not a pho snob, so i'm not really sure what makes tripe and tendon either amazing or disgusting, always seems the same goodness to me.

i'd be tempted to deduct a point just cuz it's really tiny inside, but hey.  so it might not be a good pic for a group larger than 4.
author: eric f.

description: Our go to place for an inexpensive family meal. We order the spring rolls, 5 spice chicken and pho and we like this so much we never venture to eat anything else!  A family owned business that deserves to be rewarded for their hard work.  They don't have booze, but you can buy a beer, keep the receipt, and bring it in with you.
author: Cynthia T.

description: I've been looking for a decent Pho restaurant close to home, and Pho 2000 is an option if I don't want to venture too far.  Tried their rare steak, tripe, and brisket Pho.  The broth is okay, only slightly better than the typical sub-par Pho broth in the city, but still lacking in depth of flavor.  Stay away form their Bun noodle dishes.  They lack flavor and the meat portions are small. Also tried their Bi Cuon (shredded pork roll) and was not impressed.  Overall, I was happy to find a passable Pho place close to home, but I will still drive to Pho Queen in Milpitas for fantastic Pho.  Why can't anyone open a superior Pho restaurant in SF?
author: Gregory C.

description: So Sunday is church and Asian food day for me and my girlfriend. lol Ok for some reason the past few Sundays we've had either Korean, Vietnamese or Chinese food. So this Sunday we decided to get some really good Pho in Little Saigon in the TL. We head torwards a place I've been to that I wanted to take her to and pass by this new place. We walk in and see that it's pretty clean since it's so new. We order the crepe lettuce wraps which were a little oily but still really good. Then I ordered my large number 1. Number 1 is always the Beef Pho special. Beef balls, tripe, tendons, you name it. Soooo good. They don't skimp. The broth was super tasty and Vietnamese food is rarely skimp on the portions but this place was extra generous with the portion of meat they put in. Definitely a gem. Will be going back again.
author: Hyung L.

description: Stumbled upon this place.  I was trying to go to Turtle Tower, but they were closed at 7:30, and it was almost 8:00.  I found this place.  Amazingly, the pho was really good.  Definitely, the best pho I've had in SF.  Plus, it was so much cheaper than any of the other places I've been too.  I could barely finish my bowl of pho, and I always finish a large bowl of pho.  It was so filling.  The broth tasted so good.  And the pho noodles were cooked just right.  This is what pho is supposed to taste like.
author: Richard F.

description: Tried to go to Pagolac and there was a wait so we ventured here instead. This place doesn't look like much from the outside but it's pretty decent on the inside. Service was super friendly and nice. Two of us ordered Pho Tai Nam and Beef Bun. OMG portions were enormous!! We only finished half of the two dishes and took the rest home. The broth was nice and light, I didn't feel overly full or gross after. I think this Pho had the most meat I had ever seen in a bowl of Pho. The bun was pretty good, though slightly light on flavor so I had to add some hoisin. Overall I would highly recommend this place and would def come here if I was in the area again. Our tab came to $13 something and we have lunch for tomorrow!!
author: Humaira M.

description:
comfort food - a big bowl of hot pho tai just hits the spot for you on a cold sunday afternoon. the broth isn't the best but it's good enough to satisfy your craving for pho in the tenderloin.

(i just read the comment below about the piece of hair...it happens. it does ruin your appetite and dissuades you to come back, but i hope you told the workers so that they are a little more careful next time. maybe they should opt for hair nets hehe).
author: Oanh N.

description: This is my friend's restaurant . I didn't even notice it until my friend and I were looking for a restaurant on Larkin St last time . Since I found out my friend owned it , I decided to try it . The chicken pho noodle was pretty good . I got E on the appetizer list which was some kind of wrap . I thought it'd be rice paper wrap that we would be able to wrap ourselves but it ended up to be some kind of weird crunchy wrap . It was good though .. no lie . The three color drink tasted okay . The restaurant is clean and the food is authentic . I will definitely be back :)
author: Eileen L.

description: delicious soups and very filling. Pho doesnt get much better.
author: Rod M.

description: omg!!!! is all i can say. Every single time i come here(which is about 3 times a wek no lie) it is the same delicious pho ga. I am a fan!! they are so kind and when i tried to buy a pho 2000 shirt they gave it to me for free since i am a regular. I know its  in a iffy neighborhood but it is so clean inside you wouldnt even think you were in the t.l. seriously the best pho place in san francisco. that is coming from someone who has tried many many many pho's from southern and northern vietnam,. Check it out!!!
author: joselyn b.

description:
I want to say right away that the pho here is amazing.  The flavors are wonderful, the noodles are pretty much perfect, and the meat is perfectly done.  Their Thai tea is also definitely worth checking out.  However, it was the service we received the second time we came here that made it worth two stars.
The first time my boyfriend and I came here, more during dinner time, the service was very nice.  Hot tea was promptly served, the waiters were courteous, and even further one of them complemented my tattoo (he had one himself).  The pho was brought out almost as soon as we ordered it and it was a great dinner

As I was craving it again recently, we decided to go back for lunch.  The restaurant was a bit more full, and there were different waiters this time around.   I have to mention this part, only because it is relative to this review, we were the only non Asian diners in the restaurant.
Once we sat down we were promptly given lukewarm tap water.  Everyone else there, including someone who came after us, were given hot tea! When the waiter came to take our order, he didn't even stay long enough to finish - my boyfriend had to ask another waiter for a drink because the first walked off to talk to someone else in the middle of our order.  Once the pho came, it was again, wonderful.  However, right away I was asked if I needed a fork, which was not only offensive but highly presumptuous.  The whole time we ate, I noticed the staff alternating between sorting receipts and watching us eat.  
The overall rudeness ruined my appetite and made for a very awkward dining experience, and I definitely wont be coming back here since it seems some of the staff treat some people very differently.
author: Sam M.

description: This was my first time eating pho. It was delicious! We ordered the chicken pho and the beef garlic noodles. The broth was flavorful and rich and the portions were huge for the price. All the ingredients appeared and tasted very fresh. The service was great as well as the food came out very quickly. We also got tons of food for the price, so you wont leave hungry. I'd definitely go back, and I'll have to try the beef pho.
author: Catherine V.

description: Went here the other night and found the pho to be quite tasty.  The broth was flavorful and the 'small' size was plentiful!   I got the #3-beef pho and added beef balls...was yummy to me!  Restaurant was clean, food was good so will defo come back!
author: Mao K.

description: I come to this place all the time (at least 2/3 times a week). Their Pho is ok but their #14/15 for bun rieu and bun Bo hue is really good here! Service is pretty good too.
author: Cindy W.

description:
This place is cheap and good.  I should have the pho next time though.

I wasn't that hungry so I just had the veggie rolls which were fine.  The fried rolls with pork and veggies were yummy.  

The service is nice and the place is fairly clean.

You can get by for less than $10 per person.
author: Brian L.

description: I always get chicken when it come s to pho. Of the handful I've tried in this city, the pho here has a deelicious broth, FRESH veggies, and FRESH chicken. What I love about about it even more is that 98% of the time, the chicken come in very lean pieces (with all respect to those who likes chicken skin, fat, & ligaments). This meal has great overall value in your health and budget. The small bowl more than fills me up. The service is prompt and friendly. The place is pretty clean looking. My only gripe is that when it's not busy, it feels as if you're always being stared at by somebody cuz of the wall mirrors on both sides of the dining area.
author: Flynn D.

description: I personally thought my pho was great. The broth was perfect. And there were plenty of broccoli and bok choy in it too. Sometimes, veggie pho is bland and boring- but this was the good stuff. The downsides were that the tofu were just big  cut up bricks of tofu and I like mine fried in my pho. The sprouts that came on the side were literally brown and I couldn't even think about putting them in my soup without gagging a little. My friend's rainbow drink was just carelessly slopped together. Service was pretty good actually. We arrived RIGHT before it got busy and say upstairs where we could look down at our food being prepared. I will go back for sure. The prices were good for what you get. It wasn't dirty and sketchy as some other Pho places. I suppose I dropped my star because of the location. When we walked out, we were literally harassed by a crackhead the ENTIRE walk to the car. If it weren't for the brown sprouts and my friend's displeasure with their food (They didn't order the pho like I did) I would have added at least one more star.
author: Jena D.

description: went here cuz them ky decided to close hella randomly at 730. the portions are good, theyre really vietnamese and they dont charge extra for meat on the side. Id recommend it.
author: boston j.

description: Love this place. Sevice was good, Pho was good. I wanted to spend some time at the table after eating my pho to write in my journal. The staff was cool about that. The restaurant is in on 2 floors. The 2nd floor feels like a cozy attic.
author: Robert C.

description: I didn't spill anything this time so there was no lack of a cleanup to complain about. The pork vermicelli bowl I ordered was pretty good and the meat was tasty.  One major complaint: who the hell uses canned mushrooms in a restaurant?  Because the service was good, I'm going to give them three stars, but seriously, can the canned mushrooms!
author: ML N.

description: Best Pho in the TL. It has more flavor. A lot of places give you bland pho and you have to spice it all up, and add a lot. I choose over Turtle Tower, and the place on Polk
author: edgar s.

description: We went searching for a hangover cure and found an OK filler. I like that it was a newer, seemingly cleaner establishment with obvious attention to health guidelines (gloves, hats, clean tables, etc). The greens were fresh and the bowls generous in size and value. The only draw back the broth -- i think it was chicken, not beef base. I could be wrong but it seemed lacking and somehow off and broth is the most important part of pho! With so many places to choose from, I don't feel like I need to come back.
author: Kimi N.

description: Their noodle soup base is wonderful, you can taste quality and prepared with good effort. I do have a great experience whenever I visit the restaurant. I always end up ordering same dish due to my lack of knowledge on Vietnamese dishes. I look forward to learning and tasting a lot more from Pho 2000.
author: Annie K.

description: i love that you can see the giant vat of pho broth boiling away as you enter the clean little restaurant! and i really enjoyed the tomato-ey crab paste pho and thought the portions were pretty good for the price. the bf really liked his beef pho as well, which had a tasty broth of its own. i'm still loyal to golden star but this is a nice alternative if i'm in the area (and turtle tower is closed).
author: Andrey C.

description: Good customer service and very friendly staff. reasonable prices, tasty food. I also like their shirts that read "Pho-nominal" :)
author: Cem T.

description: i FINALLY made it to the famous pho 2000.  it was okay.  i walked past about ten other places to get pho on the way there that are way better.  still, nothing a little chili sauce can't fix!  and they don't serve beer, which is almost an ingredient in pho!
author: Hammer Time H.

description: I am from LA. I was visiting san francisco and decided to walk around "little saigon" (the SF version of little saigon is weak!).  I was in the mood for some pho and started looking at restaurants in the street. I almost ate at the turtle place but it was busy so I decided to keep walking and by chance I walked by this place. At first I was hesitant to go in because from the outside it looked like a shaddy hole in the wall restaurant. I walked in and notice that they had an open kitchen near the door which i was extremely impressed about. This showed me that they were clean and was not afraid to let you see how they prepared the food. I ordered the large pho which was like .75 cents more than the small.  Totally worth it!!! . When my pho came out, the bowl was HUGE. It was the first time I had ever been to a Pho restaurant where I couldn't even finish my bowl of Pho. I was full and still had a lot of noodles and meat left over. The soup was hot and  delicious. The eye of round meat was cut thin just the way I like it.  everything was Perfect . Note: I am very picky when it comes to pho and this was literally the Best Pho place I have ever been to. Every time I go to a pho restaurant here in LA I always have a complaint regarding the pho. ie most pho place dont cut the eye of round steak as thin as it should be. most of the time the steak is cut too thick and when the steak is cut too thick it become really chewy and hard to eat whereas if the steak is cut thin then it is soft and easy to eat.  The meat at this place was sliced perfectly thin. Since Ive been to this place, all other pho places here in LA cannot compare. I am definitely coming back here next time I visit SF.
author: Eric T.

description: best damn pho i've had so far. pho sho! distinctive flavor, clean broth, quality meat, noodles done just right. don't let the quirky name put you offf- this is as good as pho gets!
author: Brett W.

description: This place is better than Turtle Tower. (I am not a fan of northern style pho and the chicken pho is super bland at TT)
author: tina M.

description: much better than the next door neighbor--turtle tower!  the food is fresh, not inundated with msg!  delightful staff. wonderful homey atmosphere and great service.  i absolutely loved the pho!
author: Kevin-louis B.

description: Solid pho - which is to be expected in the middle of the tenderloin.  Staff was really attentive and friendly - especially with the water refills.  Imperial rolls were very crispy and came with loads of lettuce and herbs to wrap with.  I was really happy with the temperature of the pho broth, it stayed nice and hot the whole meal (I really hate when then broth gets too cold by the time I am slurping up the last part of my soup).  My biggest gripe might be more of preference than anything else - the broth was a touch too sweet.  I am sure there are people that would have no problem with this, but I tend to like my broth more savory than sweet.  I will say that I can vouch that the broth is made in house as the staff came by several times with huge vats of beef bones for the broth.   If you don't mind sweeter broth then Pho 2000 is a great option, the place is really clean and there is an open kitchen.
author: Dana H.

description:
i believe that anything wrong with you can be cured by pho.  hangover, cold, breakup, whatever. 

 this is not a place to go for a good bowl of pho.  i was quite disappointed.

cute restaurant, but the broth wasnt very flavorful, and the small amount of meat was a crappy cut and slightly grisly.

there are alot of choices for pho in this neighborhood, i wont be returning here
author: CC C.

description: great veggie pho, nice smooth noodles, came with both mint and basil leaves.
author: Aaron S.

description: Best so far, since Golden Flower changed owners.  A little on the sweet side.  Some of the workers are very earnest and nice.  Have to ask for soup to very hot, since it wasn't the first time I came.  And they forgot the meatballs in my take out, which seem to be a common occurrence with pho places.  Have since replace the wooden wall with acrylic where they cook in the front.  Lunch spot, since it's in the TL.
author: e g.

description: Very tasty bowl of Southern Vietnamese Pho.  So far, my favorite in SF.  Great service, and I like how the kitchen is right in the front of the restaurant where you can literally watch them in the act of making your bowl!  The noodles are al-dente, the meat tender and fresh, the broth is savory but not overbearing, and they keep the tea coming nice and hot.  Haven't had much of their other items, cuz the pho has kept me happy : )
author: Peter D.

description: my bf and i eat good pho in long beach, ca so we were curious to see if we could find some good pho in SF that would blow our minds and end our long SF trip in a good way..PHO 2000 has it! the pho was awesome (steak pho)..broth was good and the place was nice.  this definitely ended our SF trip on a good note. taste like home cookin'
author: Lisa R.
